meanings.definition: The process of bearing fruit or becoming fruitful.
meanings.sent1: The fructification of the apple tree took many months.
meanings.sent2: The farmer eagerly awaited the fructification of his crops.
meanings.sent3: The fructification of the strawberry plant was a sweet success.
meanings.sent4: The fructification of her hard work was finally visible in the form of a successful business.
meanings.sent5: The fructification of the seed was a beautiful sight to behold.

meanings.definition: The act of producing fruit or offspring.
meanings.sent1: The fructification of the cherry tree delighted the gardener.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit's fructification was a joyful event for the family.
meanings.sent3: The fructification of the pear tree brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: The fructification of their love was a beautiful baby boy.
meanings.sent5: The fructification of the vineyard was a bountiful harvest.

meanings.definition: The result or product of growth and development.
meanings.sent1: The fructification of her efforts was a successful project completion.
meanings.sent2: The fructification of the caterpillar's transformation amazed the children.
meanings.sent3: The fructification of the idea led to a brilliant invention.
meanings.sent4: The fructification of the team's hard work was a well-deserved victory.
meanings.sent5: The fructification of the acorn was a mighty oak tree.
